page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW-RURAL OXON.
page.content: Our 4km by 3km block is an area of {south Oxfordshire}situated between Abingdon and Didcot.It is bounded by the villages of{Drayton}in the north west,{Culham}in the north east and {Milton}in the the south west.There is no town in our D-block but it encompasses a total of four villages; the three all ready mentioned plus the village of{Sutton Courtenay.}The{River {Thames}meanders through the block and because of this the area is low lying.It is characterised by farm land and some pasture but mainly arable.Each village has its own Primary school but at the transfer age of eleven all children are bussed into a Comprehensive school in either Abingdon or Didcot.Our D-block is criss-crossed by minor roads,it contains several farms and a power station.
